message.content:
1. People were allocated to buprenorphine during detoxification.
2. Those allocated to buprenorphine had fewer visits to professional carers during detoxification.
3. More people allocated to buprenorphine were abstinent at three months.
4. The number of people abstinent at three months was 10 for those on buprenorphine versus 4 for others.
5. The relative risk (RR) of abstinence at three months for those on buprenorphine was 1.55.
6. The confidence interval (CI) for the RR of abstinence at three months for those on buprenorphine was 0.96–2.52.
7. More people allocated to buprenorphine were abstinent at six months post detoxification.
8. The number of people abstinent at six months was 7 for those on buprenorphine versus 3 for others.
9. The relative risk (RR) of abstinence at six months for those on buprenorphine was 1.45.
10. The confidence interval (CI) for the RR of abstinence at six months for those on buprenorphine was 0.84–2.49.

messages.content:
Statement: People allocated to buprenorphine had fewer visits to professional carers during detoxification and more were abstinent at three months (10 vs 4, RR 1.55 CI 0.96–2.52) and six months post detoxification (7 vs 3, RR 1.45 CI 0.84–2.49).

List all the facts we explicitly know from the statement. Make each fact as atomic as possible.
